org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.base.itc.igraph

Interface ITcDataSource<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type parameter of the node
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TransitiveClosureHelper
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountingAlg, DRedAlg, IncSCCAlg, TransitiveClosureHelperImpl

    public interface ITcDataSource<V>
    This interface defines those methods that a transitive reachability data source should provide.
    Author:
    Tamas Szabo

    • Method Summary

      • isReachable

                  V target)

        Parameters:
        source - the source node
        target - the target node
        Returns:
        true if target is reachable from source, false otherwise

      • getReachabilityPath

        java.util.List<V> getReachabilityPath(V source,
                                    V target)
        Returns a reachability path between the given source and target elements, or null if no such transitive reachability is present in the graph. The returned List contains the nodes along the path (this means that there is an edge in the graph between two consecutive nodes), including the source and target nodes. A self loop (one edge) is indicated with the source node being present two times in the returned List.

        Note that the paths are not maintained incrementally and in worst case the complexity of the path construction is O(|V|+|E|) (one depth-first graph traversal). There is no guarantee that the given path is the shortest one between the given two nodes.

        Parameters:
        source - the source node
        target - the target node
        Returns:
        a path between the nodes, or null if target is not reachable from source

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Call this method to properly dispose the data structures of a transitive closure algorithm.
